page.title: 18SERVICES (UTILITIES)
page.content: {Postal}deliveries operate through the Post Office in Askrigg. The Head Post Office is in Darlington and this area is DL8. {Water}is obtained locally, although during severe droughts, it has to be transported into the area from further down the Dale by tanker. {Electricity}supplies come from the National Grid, but power for one joinery and lighting for Low Mill is derived from the River Bain. There is a{Police}House in Breconbar. The{ambulance}station in Bainbridge is controlled from Harrogate, through which even local emergency calls must be channelled. This is a vital service as the area is twenty miles from the nearest hospital. {Bus services}are few and diminishing. There is some local pressure for the establishment of a Post-Bus service.
